sentences.sContent: The light was too dim for me to distinguish anything clearly.
sentences.sCn: 光线太暗，我什么也看不清。

sentences.sContent: ...Culture is still used as a mark to distinguish one social class from another...
...a new way for the middle class to distinguish themselves from what they perceive to be the narrow tastes of those beneath them in the social hierarchy...
...if we lack the ability to distinguish the true information from the misleading one...
...a host of people cannot distinguish right from wrong...

synos.tran: 区分；辨别；使杰出，使表现突出

remMethod.val: di(分开) ＋ sting(刺) ＋ uish → 将刺挑出来 → 区别， 辨别

words.tran: 明显的；独特的；清楚的；有区别的
可区别的；辩认得出的；可辨识的
区别；差别；特性；荣誉、勋章

trans.tranCn: 区别， 辨别， 识别； 使杰出； 使著名
trans.tranOther: to recognize and understand the difference between two or more things or people
